info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 3:25PM MDT until June 24 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
FFWEPZ
The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Sierra County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 630 PM MDT.
* At 325 PM MDT, thunderstorms were producing heavy rain east of the Black Range and west of the Rio Grande Valley. Runoff from these storms will cause water to flow in Palomas Creek, Seco Creek, and Animas Creek. Low water crossings will likely become inundated, especially in Palomas Canyon and along Animas Creek.
Across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, arroyos, and low water crossings, as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Caballo, San Miguel, Palomas, Ladder Ranch, Williamsburg, Upper Palomas Canyon, Lower Palomas Canyon, Lower Animas Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
